greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pascal's "rhombus" (actually a triangle) mod 2, read by rows: each entry is sum modulo 2 of 3 terms above it in previous row and one term above it two rows back.
comment: Also, the triangle, read by rows, of successive generations in the reversible cellular automaton RCA(3) when started with a single ON cell at generation 0. - _Robert Price_, Mar 22 2017
reference: Macfarlane, Alan J. "Linear reversible second-order cellular automata and their first-order matrix equivalents." Journal of Physics A: Mathematical and General 37.45 (2004): 10791. See Fig. 4.
link: J. Goldwasser et al., The density of ones in Pascal's rhombus, Discrete Math., 204 (1999), 231-236.
Paul K. Stockmeyer, The Pascal Rhombus and the Stealth Configuration, arXiv:1504.04404 [math.CO], 2015.
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 26 2001
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jan 30 2001
